alert.note: Alert for Cameron; Clearfield; Elk; Northern Centre; Northern Clinton; Potter (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 2:42AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN ELK...NORTHEASTERN CLEARFIELD...NORTHWESTERN CENTRE...SOUTHERN POTTER...EASTERN CAMERON AND NORTHWESTERN CLINTON COUNTIES THROUGH 345 AM EDT... At 241 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Austin to near Clearfield. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clearfield, Wharton, Keating, Woodland, Hyde, Renovo, Plymptonville, Karthaus, South Renovo, Pine Glen, Cross Fork, Westport, Stevenson Dam, Cherry Springs State Park, Tamarack, Lecontes Mills, Kettle Creek State Park, Ole Bull State Park, Morrisdale and Grassflat. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

area.areaDesc: Cameron; Clearfield; Elk; Northern Centre; Northern Clinton; Potter
